Package gw.pl.persistence.type

Interface EntityTypeReference<T extends Bean>

All Superinterfaces:
com.guidewire.commons.metadata.types.IEntityTypeCache
All Known Implementing Classes:
CCRuleTypeReference, com.guidewire.commons.metadata.types.EntityIntrinsicTypeReference
public interface EntityTypeReference<T extends Bean> extends com.guidewire.commons.metadata.types.IEntityTypeCache
A reference to an entity type.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    T
    newInstance(Bundle bundle)
    Deprecated.
    This method is not safe in general, because it doesn't account for required parameters, nor does it respect the intended visibility of entity constructors.
    T

    Deprecated.
    This method is not safe in general, because it doesn't account for required parameters, nor does it respect the intended visibility of entity constructors.

    Methods inherited from interface com.guidewire.commons.metadata.types.IEntityTypeCache

    get, getName

  • Method Details

    • newInstance

      @Deprecated T newInstance(Bundle bundle)
      Deprecated.
      This method is not safe in general, because it doesn't account for required parameters, nor does it respect the intended visibility of entity constructors. If T is known at compile time, then use the entity constructor instead, if available. If it is not available, then either this entity is abstract or is not intended to be constructed directly by user code. If T is not known at compile time, then use Bundle.newBeanInstance(gw.entity.IEntityType) instead, but note that this method should be used with caution.
      Creates a new instance of the entity associated with this reference in the given bundle.
      Parameters:
      bundle - the bundle in which to create the new instance
      Returns:
      the new instance

    • newInstance

      @Deprecated T newInstance(Bundle bundle, TypeKey subtype)
      Deprecated.
      This method is not safe in general, because it doesn't account for required parameters, nor does it respect the intended visibility of entity constructors. Furthermore, it is not type-safe, as there is no guarantee that the subtype parameter is actually a subtype of T. If the subtype is known at compile time, then use the entity constructor instead, if available. If it is not available, then this entity is not intended to be constructed directly by user code. If the subtype is not known at compile time, then use Bundle.newBeanInstance(gw.entity.IEntityType) instead, but note that this method should be used with caution.
      Creates a new instance of the associated entity in the given bundle.
      Parameters:
      bundle - the bundle in which to create the new instance
      subtype - the subtype typekey, which must be in the subtype hierarchy of the entity associated with this reference.
      Returns:
      the new instance
